website_summaries.verdict: The best way to have a small portable mixer without sacrificing quality sound output.
pros: Comes in two-channel, three-channel, and four-channel varieties depending on your DJ settings
Has master, record, and headphone outputs
Provides separate volume and equalization controls for each channel
Sliders run smoothly in their tracks for instant use
cons: USB connection has a high degree of latency

customer_reviews.title: Nice mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Numark M6 to match my Numark NTX1000 turntables. I am beginner vinyl player not a DJ so I can only speak from that perspective, having said that based on what I have experienced so far a vinyl DJ would enjoy this setup. The mixer was easy to setup, I have not used the USB yet.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: At first it was fine.. But then the crossfader slowly started to ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok Im going to be STRAIGHT UP with you. .. I bought this mixer a year ago when I first started scratching. At first it was fine.. But then the crossfader slowly started to bleed. I bought an innofader and had it installed in this mixer to replace the crossfader and NOW this mixer is AMAZING. Its simple and its layout is great. However, if you are going to even MARKET this to scratch DJs you need to do something about that crossfader. Its pretty bad. ALSO no xlr in the back FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Beland

customer_reviews.title: I like these mixers
customer_reviews.text: I like these mixers. I have had a couple, but the crossfaders leak the audio. I have spoken to Numark just recently and they are aware all these years about the issue. I just bought there latest version and still, the issue persists. They are always good about sending a replacement crossfader, but they leak the opposite channel as well. Other than this a great mixer. I reached out to them as said " It would be great to see you make a version with a working crossfader and also considerably higher quality sound" I'd pay for a premium version of this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Was really hoping this would be great. I have had Newmark mixers for the last 25 years. The sound out of this mixer is fantastic, I just want to say that. The problem I have it that you can't isolate PGM from Cue in the headphones. Cue is totally overpowered from PGM in the headphones which makes beat mixing totally impossible. This mixer will be going back and I will continue on my search for a good mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H.

customer_reviews.title: Better than I anticipated!
customer_reviews.text: Better unit than I bargained for! I've worked on many nice mixers both DJ and live music. This unit is much nicer than the price would suggest. Very glad I picked it up. I do have to say that the cross-fader behavior threw me, but other than that, it's very nice. Both the sliders and pots move well, connections seem solid. I appreciate the XLR outs and the grounding lugs for my older turntables. I would definitely recommend this and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: PFord

customer_reviews.title: There's nothing special here, but Numark tends to be ...
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing special here, but Numark tends to be solid for the most part and I've used them for years. You get all the basics for 4 channels plus XLR outputs (oh, and USB, which I haven't connected to yet). This is a fairly large unit, about the same size and general layout as the normal Pioneer DJM 4-channel mixers. It isn't light, so it's not a go-to for portability. If you just want the basics with extra channels, this is a solid deal for the money. I just hope the fader holds out for a while.
customer_reviews.author: bk238

customer_reviews.title: Clean sound and USB input...!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third one. I have loved them all. The first one died in an unexpected rain storm. The second one was injured protecting the laptop it was hooked up to when it got knocked off the table... Ended up giving it to another DJ buddy who needed a simple mixer and didn't need the USB input. On my third one now and hope to give it a better home than I did the others. Does all it is suppose to do without any issues ever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great mixer at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mixer at a great price... The only thing that caused me a bit of trouble is that the measures that are listed under product dimensions are completely wrong. The mixer is 12.5 x 14 x 3.25 inches (on the page it says it's 4 x 2 x 2)..
customer_reviews.author: AE

customer_reviews.title: Good basic, easy to use mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Very good mixer for the money! Simple to use and straightforward controls. I use it for a simple bar/restaurant install and they love it!
customer_reviews.author: Rock Steady DJ

customer_reviews.title: Six month of happiness and start to fail !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the mine and just at 6 months of use ocasionally starts to fail the mono and stereo selector, every 20 minutes one audio channel stop sound. Checking for button selector replacement and surprise !! this model is discontinued by manufacturer. today only works at monoaural sound. Bad selection and bad luck of buying discontinued equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Leonel Velasquez Alpirez

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer, NOT for skratching.
customer_reviews.text: Very good 4 channel mixer. Numark has been in the game for a long time, they do things right. The only reason I returned this mixer was because of the crossfader. It simply could not produce that mm channel ultra cut that we need while cutting. But mixing with it, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: DJ 4EST

customer_reviews.title: I liked the look of this mixer
customer_reviews.text: I liked the look of this mixer...but the queing feature for the headphones didn't work, straight out of the box. I couldn't use it for spinning vinyl, which messed up my vinyl night...so I used it for an easy gig where I only used my laptop, and didn't have to cue up. If it would have worked right, I would have given it a better rating.
customer_reviews.author: sandra l schuschu

customer_reviews.title: 2nd channel gave out on 5th gig
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap broke 45 days after I bought it on my 5th gig. Lost 2nd channel. I kept it in a road case and only took it out to gig. Cant believe it. Smdh. Save your money and buy another mixer.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Can't Beat This!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent buy. Have Tehnics Sl-!200MK2 and SL1300MK2 tables. Both mounted too far from amp, got hum because of low cartridge outputs. This solved that and is nice addition to aesthetics as well. Does a lot for the price.
customer_reviews.author: my2cents

customer_reviews.title: This mixer works great, for the price
customer_reviews.text: This mixer works great, for the price, and it's my very first mixer as expected all knobs and buttons works smoothly. Sounds great too.. One downside, No fancy FX.
customer_reviews.author: Dogs25

customer_reviews.title: You need this to go to the next level... USB to laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Worked super with my DJ software. Clean smooth sound. Plentiful adjustments for that crisp clear presents we all look for in a show.
customer_reviews.author: THE JAMMER

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Great mixer for the price point. You get the basics and a little extra with this bad boy. I'm a big fan of the 1/4" Mic direct input and the EQ's are pretty solid. I use it in the house and will gig out from time to time if I'm feeling fizzy!
customer_reviews.author: Ted Shumaker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mixer!
customer_reviews.text: Great mixer for the price. I had a older Numark mixer that was made in Japan that lasted for years. I upgraded to this mixer and am very happy with it's features. Great product and super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: mr.chinatown

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I use with my Technics 1200s for just vinyl and I love it. The controls are beautifully smooth and responsive. Great price

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a mixer to get rid of one of my speakers to upgrade it but the mixer was built in to that speaker, now I have true left/right sound, its kinda big and bulky but once you hook it up at the gig you dont really have to mess with any more since I use virtual Dj

customer_reviews.title: The sound is amazing
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is great the sound is awsome thank you Amazon for take me to the next level.

customer_reviews.title: already familiar with vendor & quality
customer_reviews.text: this will be used as an external mixer (& backup, if computer crashes) with cd players & traktor pro. perfect for what i need.

customer_reviews.text: I am using the USB output to a desktop computer running Windows 7. Windows recognized it immediately. Only thing I noticed is that when I selected mono mix, the USB output stayed stereo.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: So after 1 year no complaints at all. Great mixer for the price. No bells and whistles. Perfect!

customer_reviews.title: Great analog product. It’s
customer_reviews.text: Everything is awesome! Only thing missing is a USB connection. But it’s nice!

customer_reviews.title: performance
customer_reviews.text: very good mixer . however I get a a load audible hum something like a 60 hz ac hum.written to numark so far no reply

customer_reviews.text: it works well but I do not like the way the voice sounds on the dedicated DJ Mike line the left hand side.

customer_reviews.title: Good value

customer_reviews.title: Big great surprise
customer_reviews.text: I love it so for. Yes it does need a slicker fader but what it does it’s great.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I’m impressed so far. I like the simplicity and the power. It does the job.

customer_reviews.title: My Son Loved This
customer_reviews.text: It's all he wanted for Christmas & he was happy he got it. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Kappen

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Overall a really decent mixer. Pretty basic but records sound pretty good and it feels sturdy. My only qualms are with the cue output (super fuzzy and distorted) and the record output (gave me some bad buzzing, but the master output worked with the interface fine).

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work, had to return it. If I remember correctly, the headphone jack and the line outs weren't working.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great 4 channel mixer,have no complain about it,the sound is impressive.

customer_reviews.title: Best scratch mixer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this mixer for the price. I use it to scratch. Works great.

customer_reviews.title: super awesome
customer_reviews.text: I like the transformer , the fader is as smooth as butter and I also like that the head phone jack is in the front of the unit. A PLUS NUMARK..... A PLUS.
customer_reviews.author: The champ is here

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mixer, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality mixer, especially for the price. Highest possible recommendation.

customer_reviews.text: The audio quality is phenomenal and i love the usb plugin to the my computer to hook into obs. love this.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: No nonsense and Straightforward

customer_reviews.title: Numark M6 USB Four-Channel USB DJ Mixer Numark M6 USB Four-Channel USB DJ Mix
customer_reviews.text: I have a nuwmark mixer from the late 80 for my two turntables and bought this one for my son, who uses it when I am not using it. Once a numark always a numark their quality is always great

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time and as described. It is exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Jett

customer_reviews.title: Great basic mixer.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in a gentlemen's club in combination with winamp on a computer. Gets the job done. Simple deck so even the slower people could get it. Only complaint is I wish it had an independent Mic volume. You can kind of work that with the master turned all the way up and then the channels have independent volume. Just an easy thing that I believe was an oversite. Over all I like it and would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Chris stakebake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: If you're a beginning DJ and what to get something right for the price then this is just what you need, eveyrthing works as it should and it's an excellent starting mixer, for 110 bucks you get 4 rca line inputs, 1 usb input/output, booth output, main output that's rca and XLR and a mic input, I would've given it 5 stars but its a little too bulky, unnecessarily big, also when you put the main volume fader up to 80% it starts to get a hissing noise and at 100% you can't ignore it, but all in all it's a great beginning mixer and excellent for the price :)
customer_reviews.author: Laura E. Araujo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed

Said blizzard wore on throughout the next couple days, but to my surprise it was there waiting for me exactly on time.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Nice DJ mixer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice DJ mixer for the price. Was shipped super fast from amazon. NOTE: This unit either doesn't filter RF noise that well or it has a tremendously low noise floor. In that case you have to use RCA cables with a groundwire, or you'll hear a nasty buzz. Make sure you have a turntable that has a ground wire hook up as well, or don't purchase this mixer. In general, this is a good practice. Going out from the mixer, my speakers didn't seem to mind not having a ground running to them, and in most cases the noise is going to come from your turntable anyway.
customer_reviews.author: ZeroCool

customer_reviews.title: Solid build, clean clear does what it needs to.
customer_reviews.text: Solid build great price, mic channel was clean and clear I really almost expected it to be noisy but it was great. For my purposes I would have preferred xlr out but not a big deal to convert if you don't run long cables. I am really pleased with this little mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Esaii Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good Entry Level Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Good beginners 2 channel mixer with decent build quality. I have started using this for amateur mixing and DJ session, great so far.

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: wow.. i was actually hoping to get my package delivered within a month, im in mexico so its an international order but my order was placed on saturday 12th oct- and it was delivered yesterday Sat 16th =D im so happy and excited i just tried it for a while and the faders are built in and they are like a pro mixer , the crossfader its so gently but it wont destroy so easily so its a pretty good product for just 179 dlls =D

customer_reviews.title: Overly impressed for underpriced mixer
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this mixer - balanced XLR outs - multiple in/out configs - USB audio sound card for recording/playing back from computer. -knobs and sliders are smooth -eq sounds very good -price vs performance the only con I can find is the how small the CUE buttons are - and they're not that small - just not a big ol button were all accustomed too. Overall - GREAT mixer for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the $$

customer_reviews.title: The size and ease of mixing is much better here. However
customer_reviews.text: I used to use a big boxy 5.1 surround sound receiver for a mixer. The size and ease of mixing is much better here. However, I don't think it has the capacity to support non active speakers, or at the very least, it is not immediately easy to have non active speakers with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: It's very nice, works very well. Built tough, Although the preview channel buttons, are little. I hope they hold up to the use i put on them. Overall very nice works fine.

Awesome!!

customer_reviews.title: Numark  M6 USB Mixer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid mixer, all the faders and knobs are well made, everything handles well. Probably the best part about this mixer is the fact that it has four (4) outputs. One Master RCA, One Booth RCA, One Recording RCA, and a Balanced XLR Output. This is perfect for a house mixer, I used it the first weekend I got it on a 3 day outdoor event with 50+ Djs and they ended up using it as the house mixer for whatever stage I was on that day. Final thought: Very very good buy. Well worth the money, even if it has no built in effects.

Its basic mainly, I would recommend this to a beginner DJ to just mix music thats about it.

customer_reviews.title: If you all are looking for a nice quality build in a mixer with no recording capabilities ...
customer_reviews.text: There is no such thing as "good" and "cheap" when it comes to DJ hardware. If you all are looking for a nice quality build in a mixer with no recording capabilities then this is the one for you. It's a quality product for the price, but the USB connection does not work with any DJ software so you would need to have CDJs or turntables to spin live with this. Gave it one star because it does not function as a midi controller and I cannot record with it since it does not communicate with laptops.

product_meta.title: Numark M2 BLACK | Professional Two-Channel Scratch Mixer with 3-band EQ per Channel
product_meta.description:
M2 is a two channel DJ scratch mixer with all the essentials to hit the stage in Numark style.

Switchable phono/line inputs for turntables, CD players, and other line sources make M2 a superb choice for any DJ setting from weddings to clubs, parties to practice setups. A mic input with dedicated EQ and gain, and a headphone output with crossfader style cueing complete the plentifully featured package.

Three band EQ on each channel plus crossfader reverse and slope controls give you all the tools you need to drive your audience from behind the wheels of steel. M2 is the perfect mixer for any scratch DJ.

TECHNICAL SPECS
 * Inputs  * (2) RCA phono/line switchable
    * (2) RCA line
    * (1) 1/4” mic
    * (1) 10V AC ~500mA
   
   
 * Outputs  * (1) RCA Master
    * (1) RCA Record
    * (1) 1/4” Headphone (stereo)
   
   
 * Dimensions: 11.4" x 9.5" x 3.6"

BOX CONTENTS
 * M2
 * AC Power Adapter
 * Quickstart Guide
 * Safety & Warranty Information Booklet
feature_bullets: Versatile, Feature Packed – Two channel DJ scratch mixer featuring must have mix essentials for any DJ setting, from weddings to clubs, parties to practice setups
Connectivity Covered – Two phono/line switchable (RCA), two line (RCA) and mic (1/4 inch) inputs, plus master (RCA), record (RCA) and headphone (1/4 inch stereo) Outputs
Made To Move, Style Driven Design – Sleek, robust and ultra portable design with radiant rackmount facilities included
Mix Control Two channels outfitted with a replaceable crossfader, dedicated channel level faders plus reverse and slope controls
The Perfect Mix Three band EQs on each channel and convenient crossfader style cueing

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars163 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
